intro: Vochysia vismiifolia var. densissima, commonly known as the dense-leaved velvetwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically opposite,革质 (leathery), and have a velvety texture. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy pulp. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland tropical forests.
